skill.name: doc-generator
skill.description: Generate markdown documentation from Python codebases by analyzing source files, extracting docstrings, type hints, and code structure. Use when the user asks to document Python code, create API docs, or generate README files from source code.
skill.summary: Generate comprehensive markdown documentation from Python source code with extracted docstrings and type hints
skill.author: bossjones

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation guide with no executable code. All 27 static findings are false positives from markdown code examples and documentation formatting. The skill describes using Python standard library tools for documentation generation with no network access or command execution.

low_findings.title: Filesystem Access for Documentation Reading
low_findings.description: The skill describes reading Python source files to generate documentation. This is legitimate functionality requiring file read access within the user workspace. Uses standard Python pathlib module for file handling.

content.user_title: Generate Python Documentation from Source Code
content.value_statement: Creating API documentation manually is time consuming and becomes outdated quickly. This skill automatically generates comprehensive markdown documentation from Python source code by extracting docstrings, type hints, and code structure into well organized reference material.
actual_capabilities: Extract module-level docstrings and class definitions from Python files
Parse function signatures with type hints and parameter descriptions
Generate structured markdown with classes, methods, and functions organized hierarchically
Process single files or entire directories recursively
Support Google, NumPy, and Sphinx docstring formats
Create usage examples from docstring content
limitations: Requires Python source files with valid syntax to parse successfully
Quality depends on existing docstrings in the source code
Does not generate documentation for code without docstrings beyond signatures

use_cases.title: API Reference Generation
use_cases.description: Software engineers building Python libraries can automatically generate API reference documentation from their codebase with all public classes, methods, and functions documented in a consistent format.

use_cases.title: Project README Creation
use_cases.description: Technical writers and project maintainers can quickly create comprehensive README files with usage examples and API documentation extracted directly from source code docstrings.
use_cases.target_user: Documentation writers and open source maintainers

use_cases.title: Legacy Code Documentation
use_cases.description: Development teams inheriting undocumented codebases can generate initial documentation structure from existing code signatures and any available docstrings as a starting point.
use_cases.target_user: Engineering teams working with legacy systems

best_practices: Ensure your Python source files have comprehensive docstrings before running documentation generation for best results
Use consistent docstring format throughout your codebase such as Google style or NumPy style for uniform output
Specify whether to include private methods with leading underscores if you need internal API documentation
anti_patterns: Do not expect detailed documentation from code without docstrings as the output will only contain signatures
Avoid running on files with syntax errors as they will be skipped with warnings
Do not use this for languages other than Python as it relies on Python AST parsing

faq.question: What docstring formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports Google style, NumPy style, and Sphinx style docstrings commonly used in Python projects.

faq.question: Can this generate documentation for code without docstrings?
faq.answer: It will extract function and method signatures with type hints, but descriptions will show as not provided without docstrings.

faq.question: Does this work with Python 2 code?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on modern Python 3 codebases with type hints and uses current AST parsing which may not support legacy Python 2 syntax.

faq.question: Can I customize the markdown output format?
faq.answer: The skill generates standard markdown structure with modules, classes, and functions. You can request specific sections or organization in your prompt.

faq.question: How are private methods handled?
faq.answer: Methods and functions with leading underscores are skipped by default unless you explicitly request documentation for private members.

faq.question: Will this modify my source code files?
faq.answer: No, this skill only reads source files to extract documentation. It generates new markdown files without modifying the original Python code.
